column1: Please remember the 10000 families in Massachusetts missing someone at the dinner table & the thousands more who are alone & fighting COVID-19. As we celebrate the kindness & generosity of others may today bring a renewed sense of gratitude for all we have to be thankful for.

Because of #COVID19 America's hunger crisis has become a hunger catastrophe. I'm walking 43 miles from Springfield to Greenfield today & tomorrow w/ @MonteBelmonte to raise awareness about the millions of Americans who are food insecure. #MontesMarch https://t.co/fMY8OGlysY

This morning on @CommonTalkPod I spoke about the 31st anniversary of the Jesuit priest murders the urgent need for #COVID19 relief legislation and how President-elect Biden will work to crush the virus and unite our country. https://t.co/CabaY873Bh

#COVID19 jeopardizes decades of progress in global child health & survival. This #ChildHealthWeek let’s work to chart a new & better path forward for all children. Thank you @unfoundation @MarchofDimes @UNICEFUSA & so many more for working to ensure gains made are not lost!
Información importante para Worcester #COVID19 ⬇️ https://t.co/8B3E7Lyqpq

‼️ IMPORTANT DEADLINE COMING UP ‼️  Please RT to help spread the word: If you or someone you know has not yet received a COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment you MUST register by Nov. 21 2020 to receive a $1200 relief check. More info below. https://t.co/S5pDFbiDvI
Important information about COVID-19 resources in Worcester #StopTheSpread ⬇️ https://t.co/9OEquhoWZP

Every Thursday AM @ 7:30 I call @MonteBelmonte to answer your questions and talk about what's happening in America on 93.9 WRSI The River. With votes being counted and #COVID19 infections hitting record highs lots to talk about from Washington to the 413. https://t.co/vzHhlBRlRV

On Thursday @DonaldJTrumpJr said deaths are "down to almost nothing."  2236+ Americans have died of COVID-19 since then. COVID-19 is currently the third leading cause of death in the United States.  No integrity. No decency. Just lie after lie after lie. https://t.co/wWr6beUtME

#Covid19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable high-speed broadband. Today the Trump @FCC doubled down on its decision to gut #NetNeutrality and jeopardize public safety and universal broadband access. We won’t stop fighting until #NetNeutrality is restored. https://t.co/aAuOvZOtJd

3/ There's no good reason why any family child senior or individual should wonder where their next meal will come from. Yet the harsh reality is that close to a billion people around the world are impacted by hunger & COVID-19 has made things even worse. https://t.co/rGl5nBGOao
Maybe if you spent less time attacking your own advisors and more time attacking COVID-19 we wouldn't be in this mess in the first place. https://t.co/mVKg6xqtKU

A COVID-19 diagnosis is an awful thing that far too many Americans have had to confront—including 200000 who have tragically died. I wish the first family a quick recovery. I’m praying for our country. Please please please wear a mask keep your distance & stay safe America.

It’s been 130+ days since the House passed the Heroes Act. Mitch McConnell moves like lightning on a SCOTUS nominee but won’t lift a finger to save lives & livelihoods with a COVID-19 stimulus package. Tells you everything you need to know about him. All he cares about is power.

200000 Americans have died due to COVID-19.  Trump gutted the pandemic response team downplayed the danger lied about it tried to slow down testing ignored medical experts & holds super-spreader rallies to boost his ego.  His reckless incompetence has cost countless lives. https://t.co/Xg0jbjhL2Q

Congress must lead by example & condemn hateful rhetoric against Asian-Americans. Here are my thoughts from earlier today in support of H. Res. 908 — Condemning all forms of anti-Asian sentiment as related to COVID-19. https://t.co/q8vQeG8Fl5

One thing on their mind is how to find safe indoor locations this winter to sell food during COVID-19.  I’m hopeful we can facilitate some relationships to make sure they & other farmers can continue to move their products to market. https://t.co/wiWZCf1VD9

Like so many others our farmers are adapting to the economic changes brought about by COVID-19.  On stop 3 today we caught up w/ Julia Coffey of Mycoterra Farm (a 2018 Farm Tour stop) who lept into action & created MassFoodDelivery to get farm-fresh foods to Massachusetts homes. https://t.co/aDlQGxFgaG

First stop: Riverland Farm in Sunderland where they’re growing 40 acres of certified organic vegetables (leeks carrots onions & more.) Owner Emily Landeck showed us around & we discussed how COVID-19 is impacting their operations/ what we can do to be wind at their back. https://t.co/W7f9OcsvIx
As the Republicans’ deadly 100 days of inaction continues the coronavirus is spiraling out of control. https://t.co/eK7iFVLFjH

This morning I spoke on the House Floor about the devastating impact that COVID-19 is having on global hunger and food security especially among children. We can and must do more! https://t.co/aEqcH9hhkc

IMPORTANT INFO: Today from 10AM to 7PM the City of Worcester & UMass Memorial are providing free masks hand sanitizer and COVID-19 testing at Main South CDC (875 Main Street). More info here ➡️➡️ https://t.co/XgTf5PxsDf

The Senate GOP‘s new COVID-19 relief proposal includes:  ✅ Tax deductions for wealthy CEOs to write off fancy lunches.  ✅ Billions of dollars for defense contractors.  ❌ Nothing for hungry families struggling to buy groceries.  They have made their priorities abundantly clear.

Despite having the highest number of COVID-19 cases in the country the Northeast received the second-lowest allocation of any geographic region—only $46 million (4.4%) of the total $1.2 billion made in the first round of @USDA distributions.  @RepPressley & I want answers. https://t.co/RsTNSNA60C

In today's @DailyHampGaz ➡️  COVID-19 has raised America's consciousness about our decades-long hunger crisis. As @SenMarkey & I fight to make ending hunger a permanent priority inside of Congress we need your help making it a priority outside of Congress.https://t.co/8RhI4Gnfp8

Food is a basic human right.  Yet during COVID-19 food banks have been inundated & America’s hunger crisis has deepened. It’s been 2 months since the House passed the Heroes Act to reinforce our anti-hunger safety net yet I hear crickets from Senate Republicans. We need action! https://t.co/f1z0eneMHb
I sat down with @RepDavidTrone to talk about why I took the #SNAP challenge of spending only $1.40/ meal for a week & what we can do about hunger in America during #COVID19. https://t.co/CVv9TTbecA
During this COVID crisis firefighters are not only responding to fires but also emergency medical calls. We need to make sure that our first responders are protected with the proper equipment.

2/2 ...how coronavirus relief legislation passed by Congress has impacted them and what more needs to be done to make our communities whole again. Learning lots of good info today to take back to my colleagues in Congress.

We're 6 months into #COVIDー19.  130000+ Americans are dead.   2900000 have gotten sick.  But instead of healing our country or working across the aisle to pass the #HeroesAct this administration is focused on pitting Americans against each other. https://t.co/wmbaqNpaK1

53K COVID19 cases today up from 39K last Wednesday. But Trump says it’s “going to disappear” even though he has no plan.  I’ve never seen such incompetent leadership in my life. Those near him get tested daily. He only cares about himself. Ignore him & listen to medical experts. https://t.co/Ya5VlT0sr2

Every American should see this. Donald Trump's complete & utter mismanagement of the coronavirus is a disaster.  120000 Americans are dead & ignoring the problem won’t make it go away. We STILL don’t have a national testing & tracing plan to reopen safely. Stunning incompetence. https://t.co/OhgyRAIKkM
There’s still time to get tested for #COVID19 at pop up sites across Massachusetts tomorrow.  Full list of locations & more information here: https://t.co/6PaTogP0tC https://t.co/hSjVadp8Jj

The MA delegation is supporting @MASchoolsK12 nutrition workers & community organizations by asking @USDA to grant a waiver allowing school districts to keep delivering meals to students during #COVID19.   We’re working to protect vulnerable kids during this difficult time. https://t.co/Sm2GUdRsYR

NEWS: I'm introducing the Protecting Human Rights During Pandemic Act to prevent human rights abuses from being carried out in the name of #COVID & to ensure that America continues standing up for #HumanRights during this challenging time. Read more: https://t.co/wJzPnJWkGt
On Friday I joined @MassAGO Maura Healey for a conversation about George Floyd employee rights during COVID-19 and more. https://t.co/yifTVu5s6k
Tomorrow at 4:00PM I'm hosting a tele-town hall update and Q&A on the coronavirus for #MA02. I hope you can join us!  Sign up to receive a call ➡️ https://t.co/ziTYjxbHaS https://t.co/HZtx7jncqR

There’s an important new resource for families w/ children during #COVID19. Created by Congress in the Families First Coronavirus Response Act it could provide additional money for your family to buy food while schools are closed. Find out more below: https://t.co/cBUfil4KNJ

Sadly the Coronavirus is accelerating the loss of too many of our oldest veterans especially WWII veterans robbing families and our nation of the last few years of the memories and wisdom of this most special and heroic generation.

In a few moments I'll be joining Hank Stolz @CommonTalkPod on WCRN live from #Worcester (at my house) for an update on the #COVID19 response both in Washington & here at home in Massachusetts.  Listen on the radio: 830 AM Listen online ⬇️ https://t.co/i6Q8Iy4ftx
Thanks to everyone who joined me for today's important call focused on the economic impact of #COVID19 on the Commonwealth’s cultural sector & creative community. https://t.co/SJjWokaQrD

TODAY at 4:00pm I'm hosting a live conversation about how #COVID19 is impacting cities & towns featuring local leaders:  ➡️ Greenfield Mayor Roxann Wedegartner ➡️ Northampton Mayor David Narkewicz ➡️ Auburn Town Manager Julie Jacobson  Watch here: https://t.co/NkkFayTAGK https://t.co/Mq7qO3azPY

#COVID19 is not a Republican problem or a Democratic problem. @senatemajldr work with us! Painting our efforts to respond as partisan & polarizing this debate does a disservice to the American people's health safety & economic well-being. https://t.co/XdhnuElSdi

1/ It has been roughly three months since the first community transmission of COVID-19 was discovered in the United States. Since that time our world has changed dramatically: there are now more than 1.3 million confirmed cases across the country. https://t.co/Znb2CNH9bl

Right now the Rules Committee is discussing my bill H.Res 965 which would temporarily allow for virtual committee work and remote voting on the House Floor during the COVID-19 pandemic. Watch live: https://t.co/kyA8ANhSxp
Years of environmental injustice have been made visible by the awful and unequal toll the coronavirus is taking on communities of color. https://t.co/M9lmELND7E

We are all in this together.  That's the idea that should guide our response to #COVID19 and that's the idea behind @HouseDemocrats Heroes Act.  This is no time to tread water. We need bold solutions matching the size and scope of the problems we face. We need the #HeroesAct. https://t.co/7tUGhnsTrs
The coronavirus pandemic is magnifying social and economic injustices and I’m glad that this federal funding will go towards vulnerable members of our community who need help. https://t.co/EeVE813e5e

NEWS: Bipartisan co-chairs of the House #Hunger Caucus/ #FoodIsMedicine Working Group @RepMarshall @RepWalorski @chelliepingree & I are asking @USDA @SecretarySonny & @USAID @JBarsaUSAID to support America's global food security & nutrition programs during #COVID19. Read more⬇️ https://t.co/yk5Gnm41Ev

Thank you to #Tibetan Associations across the U.S. that contributed more than $35K to @_MealsOnWheels to help vulnerable Americans during the COVID-19 pandemic.  In these trying times it's gestures of solidarity like this that uplift our spirits & reaffirm our shared humanity.

The coronavirus pandemic is magnifying social and economic injustices in our community and I’m glad that this federal funding will go towards vulnerable members of our community who need help. https://t.co/lN2ao8Yr4z

This is ridiculous. We are in the middle of a public health crisis. #COVID has claimed nearly 75000 American lives. And President Trump's answer is to take health care away from people and eliminate protections for people w/ pre-existing conditions. https://t.co/yDZBab4oOR

He could support a resolution my colleague @RepGraceMeng introduced last month (H.Res. 908) condemning all forms of anti-Asian sentiment related to COVID-19. To date there are 144 Democratic co-sponsors and only 1 Republican co-sponsor. https://t.co/iheUXpDfrr

Instead of a GOP partisan task force designed to divert attention from President Trump’s coronavirus response failures @GOPLeader McCarthy could get serious about holding the Chinese government accountable by supporting bipartisan initiatives. https://t.co/cReztlKDHs

#COVID19 has revealed the tireless dedication of America’s teachers.   This #TeacherAppreciationWeek we thank our teachers who are going above and beyond to serve their students. #ThankATeacher https://t.co/jb4iLerb3a

Our local state & federal team is working together to support our workers & families and keep our communities safe & healthy.   I joined @GreenfieldMA Mayor Wedegartner Sen. @Jo_Comerford & @RepPaulMark at today’s press conference to discuss our ongoing #COVID19 response. https://t.co/di7uBNt5q4

Today @SenatorLeahy & I are pressing @SecPompeo & @stevenmnuchin1 to immediately confirm that U.S. policy does not preclude shipments of medical equipment food or other humanitarian items to #Cuba to combat #COVID19.   Read our full letter: https://t.co/02Rya6RuWk

#HumanRights don't go away during a pandemic. Foreign governments should release arbitrarily detained Americans & all prisoners of conscience on humanitarian grounds immediately.  My statement w/ @ChrisCoons @SenThomTillis & @RepChrisSmith. #COVID19 https://t.co/v8jfZdwV4O

Please don’t avoid seeking medical care for a non-coronavirus related medical emergency. Health care providers are working hard to ensure that everyone can stay safe during this pandemic. https://t.co/BXX1rpdClt

#COVID19 exposed just how unprepared Congress is to continue its business during an unforeseen crisis.   Inaction isn't an option — it's time for us to embrace tech so we can safely keep legislating in an emergency.  My new op-ed in the @washingtonpost:  https://t.co/5xzsY9ehFX

#HumanRights don't go away during a pandemic. Foreign governments should release arbitrarily detained Americans & all prisoners of conscience on humanitarian grounds immediately.   My statement w/ @ChrisCoons @SenThomTillis & @RepChrisSmith. #COVID19 https://t.co/v8jfZdfkdg

#COVID19 exposed just how unprepared Congress is to continue its business during an unforeseen crisis. Inaction isn't an option — it's time for us to embrace tech so we can safely keep legislating in an emergency.  📰 My op-ed in today's @washingtonpost ⬇️ https://t.co/9YkyGsow9f

#2020Census pro tip: If your college students are home because of COVID-19 they should still be counted “where they usually live and sleep most of the time.” For most students that means in their college town. Get the facts then help them respond: https://t.co/6gpauSazIs

2/ Last week the House passed my bill H.Res. 935 creating a new investigatory panel to make sure hard-earned taxpayer dollars are spent on the small businesses and workers who need help because of the #coronavirus.   We need accountability transparency and fairness. https://t.co/vpuUqCVxcI

Foreign governments should release arbitrarily detained Americans & all prisoners of conscience on humanitarian grounds immediately. My statement alongside ➡️@ChrisCoons @SenThomTillis & @RepChrisSmith. #HumanRights #COVID19  https://t.co/v8jfZdfkdg

We're experiencing a crisis of food insecurity not seen in America in decades. Hungry families can't wait.   I'm leading 139 Members of Congress calling for anti-hunger programs like SNAP to be prioritized in the next #COVID19 relief bill ➡️ https://t.co/3sZJ4rvoO9

#MitchAntoinette would rather deny aid to firefighters police & EMS than deliver the relief they need to keep fighting the coronavirus. This is a disgusting remark to make when American lives are on the line. https://t.co/puBU5RKG6O

My heart is heavy for @SenWarren following the loss of her brother. The coronavirus has brought so much sadness and heartbreak to our country.  Elizabeth — Lisa & I will keep you & your entire family in our prayers during this difficult time.

At least 40 children in Office of Refugee Resettlement custody have come down with #COVID19. How are children who are detained supposed to socially distance?  We're calling on @HHSGov & @DHSgov to release them ASAP. Anything less would be heartless & cruel. https://t.co/djPCw2bp1N

Tonight the Rules Committee met to establish a select subcommittee on the coronavirus crisis.  Congress must ensure that the taxpayer dollars we've allocated to respond to this crisis are well spent: that means saving lives rooting out fraud & fighting for ALL small businesses. https://t.co/Af9zLUirjj

Trump & Senate GOP: It's up to the states to organize a #COVID19 response.  Also Trump & Senate GOP: We won't provide funding for state & local #COVID19 response.  Confused? That's because it makes no sense at all.

Thank you President Tsai @iingwen for your generous donation of medical masks to the @MassEMA warehouse.   #Taiwan’s early and proactive efforts serve as an example to the world of how to effectively prevent the spread of #COVID19. We appreciate your help. https://t.co/mgIdy90pWr

And thank you @joshuawongcf @SunnyCheungky @demosisto @networkdiplohk for your generous donation to @umassmemorial caregivers to fight #COVID19. We are grateful for your support and friendship. I am very proud of our work together to support human rights & democracy in #HongKong! https://t.co/0zqvWF9j2T

The #coronavirus crisis is causing levels of hunger in America not seen in decades & decades.  Thank you @chefjoseandres for explaining what we're fighting for. America has MORE THAN ENOUGH food — what we lack is the political will to ensure nobody in this country goes hungry. https://t.co/0qOQjaajMi
TONIGHT: Join me for a telephone town hall to answer your questions and discuss our #coronavirus response here in Massachusetts & across the nation. https://t.co/yu6vWHpTrK

TOMORROW: I'm hosting another telephone town hall to answer your questions and discuss our coronavirus response in Massachusetts and at the federal level.  Keeping you and your family healthy safe and informed during this crisis is my #1 priority and I hope you can join. https://t.co/m93AcFRxjs

Governments must both guarantee prisoners’ right to health and protect their societies from those who have committed grave crimes. #Honduras must not use the #coronavirus as an excuse to free the men who murdered Berta Cáceres. #JusticeForBerta https://t.co/14X3H0qQq3

Coronavirus cases & deaths aren't just numbers on a screen.   They're beloved members of our community with families & friends whose lives have been changed forever by this pandemic. My thoughts are with everyone in #MA02 & across America who has lost a loved one. https://t.co/AKpZC6tzqm

This year #BlackMaternalHealthWeek comes in the midst of a pandemic.  The racial disparities in COVID-19 outcomes reflect ongoing disparities in maternal mortality rates in the U.S. As a Member of the @BMHCaucus I am working hard to address this crisis. #BMHW20 https://t.co/rGALNlDELG

Wow. @Deans_Beans in #Orange is donating 1000 pounds of fresh organic coffee to those impacted by #COVID19 & thousands of tin ties for face masks. Our community is coming together to take care of & look out for each other. We are stronger together. Thank you Dean's Beans! https://t.co/6E0ExzBNux

When I say the lack of leadership at the White House is a disaster this is what I mean:  "On the evening of April 10 the @DeptofDefense received approval from the White House Task Force to execute the first DPA Title 3 project responding to COVID-19." https://t.co/dR6yAxg1Eb

Everyone needs to watch. Even before #COVID19 #hunger was a dire problem in America — now the level of hunger & food insecurity we are seeing is nothing short of a humanitarian catastrophe.  Congress MUST prioritize food in our next coronavirus relief package. https://t.co/DA8TiQjy7K

It's not surprising that America's racial disparities are reflected in our broken healthcare system. But it is outrageous and wrong.  Communities of color are being disproportionately impacted by #COVID19.  We need data. We need action. We need justice. https://t.co/KCp3wam70B

2/ I also sent this letter to @USTreasury Secretary @stevenmnuchin1 last week encouraging him to make sure smaller communities are not left behind or left out as we support local #coronavirus response efforts. https://t.co/R1JNbwoJda

🚜 #Farmers work day and night to keep food on our table — we need to be there for them during the #coronavirus crisis and do everything possible to support local farms & local food.  Proud to join this letter asking @SBAgov to allow farmers to access federal disaster loans. https://t.co/5FaUEKdBvI

This morning I joined @ClarkUniversity students for a class called the politics of food and drink. We talked about food insecurity and how #coronavirus could make #hunger much worse if our government doesn't take action. Thanks for letting me join and for the great questions! https://t.co/BvVXzk6hcs

ICYMI: @MassDeptAgr has created a great new webpage that focuses on how and where to buy fresh local food including how to find pick up and delivery options during the pandemic. #Massachusetts #mapoli #COVIDー19 https://t.co/GwReLsqjGT
Important info from the Massachusetts @HealthConnector: make sure you update your account if you experience a change in income due to #COVIDー19! https://t.co/2W0NTpuc65

Looking for more detailed information about the bipartisan legislation that has been signed into law to address the coronavirus crisis? We pulled together a resources page to keep everything in one place ⤵️ https://t.co/qbl13sdoLa

#MA02 #SmallBiz: if you've been impacted by #COVID19 here's a flow chart of how you can navigate the emergency relief process now that the #CARESAct has passed.  Please RT to spread the word & help #SmallBusiness in #Massachusetts! https://t.co/n3EE2rVkSC

10/ Getting feedback from people on the front lines during a crisis is critical — so I hosted another emergency conference call with local public health authorities to gather input about our COVID-19 response at the local state and federal levels. https://t.co/ULtQD589IF
9/ We also built a dedicated COVID-19 resources page on my website where #MA02 residents can find local accurate up-to-date information during this time of uncertainty. https://t.co/J1N4TujYHx
8/ By the way EVERYONE needs to do their part to #StopTheSpread of COVID-19. For example my staff and I are teleworking and we canceled my public events. https://t.co/WeCQgq4SKD

6/ As Chair of @RulesDemocrats I helped bring to the House Floor the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act the second phase of our response. It secures paid emergency leave enhanced unemployment insurance & more. https://t.co/rvs3PlcGFP

3/ Massachusetts needs a robust coordinated federal response to this crisis. So the day after my conference call our Congressional Delegation asked the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force to take urgent & specific steps to help our state respond. ⤵️ https://t.co/LtR0Sp29zr

2/ Before we had any confirmed cases of #COVID19 in #MA02 I organized an emergency conference call with health care providers to discuss whether or not they had the information tools and resources needed to keep our community safe. https://t.co/nE2XbpREiK

THREAD: I want to be as open & accountable as possible to the people of Massachusetts' Second District about what actions my team and I have taken to address the #COVID19 crisis.  Here's a list of some of what we've been up to. (1/?)

Hospitals are using refrigerated trucks to hold the bodies of #COVID victims in New York. Doctors and nurses are using trash bags to protect themselves and splitting ventilators to save people.  And Trump is tweeting about how popular he is on TV. https://t.co/UCuVpwOiFm

I just voted in support of a bipartisan Coronavirus relief package to help get Americans the relief they need during this emergency.  I know this bill is not perfect. But we're far from done & I promise I’ll keep fighting #ForThePeople as we continue to address this crisis. https://t.co/JgzAuKa5G0

This pandemic knows no borders and is not constrained by history or politics. I agree with those calling on the United States to suspend #Cuba sanctions to facilitate humanitarian aid amid #COVID19 ⬇️ https://t.co/dZcTF1YyQH

ICYMI: last week my team and I put together a comprehensive #coronavirus resource center on my website that we've been updating daily as information becomes available. Take a look ⤵️ https://t.co/J1N4TujYHx

Be careful of #COVID19 scams during this crisis.  ❌ Price gouging? ➡️ Call @MassAGO’s Consumer Protection Hotline at 617-727-8400.  ❌ Only trust your doctor for info on treatments.  ❌ Be on the lookout for unauthorized or fraudulent charities & solicitations.

10 years later the Affordable Care Act is protecting 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions to ensure they access to the health care they need as we fight the coronavirus. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/55aBawPGB6

Thank you to everyone who joined me for last night’s town on the coronavirus including our guest experts U.S. Small Business Administration Massachusetts Director Bob Nelson & Dr. Eric Dickson from Umass Memorial Health Care. https://t.co/U0sARZabhq

LOOKING FOR HELP? The Massachusetts Department of Unemployment Assistance will be holding virtual town halls the rest of this week to help anyone who has been affected by the coronavirus.  More information on how to sign up here➡️ https://t.co/zC6jF30rX1 https://t.co/UOyudhvZNR
We want to make sure ALL health care facilities — including in rural and disadvantaged areas — can get funds for important telehealth services during #COVID19. https://t.co/JYfQUzNCYl

HAPPENING SOON: I'm holding a telephone town hall at 5:30PM to answer your questions and discuss the #coronavirus with healthcare and small business experts from #Massachusetts. https://t.co/Kdfg0BRmZn

I am so grateful for the teachers across America who are stepping up to support their students and make sure they continue learning during this crisis. Our community is thankful for all your work! #COVIDー19 #Coronavirus https://t.co/I3ny5yVgy8

TOMORROW: I'm holding a live telephone town hall at 5:30PM to answer your questions and discuss the #COVIDー19 #coronavirus w/ healthcare and small business experts from #Massachusetts. https://t.co/NMV8wHMjOi

#COVID19 highlights the importance of full participation in the census. The census helps the federal government allocate federal funds during and after an emergency including healthcare services for seniors and other at-risk groups. https://t.co/8VMS1er5w8

A CDC analysis of U.S. #COVID19 cases from Feb. 12 to March 16 shows that 38% of those sick enough to be hospitalized were YOUNGER than 55.  Bottom line: everybody no matter their age needs to immediately take steps to protect themselves! https://t.co/FpV7htRPIn

My team and I want to make sure we get you the most accurate and helpful #COVID19 information and facts. We've created this new #Massachusetts resource page on my website that will be updated and improved daily. https://t.co/J1N4TujYHx

Thankfully @HouseDemocrats included in our #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act quick relief from harsh work requirements during this pandemic.  We will not stop fighting for America's workers families and communities. #ForThePeople

Important alert: the @USTreasury & @IRSnews are providing emergency relief to individuals & businesses in response to #COVID19.   The tax filing deadline remains April 15 but income tax payment deadlines for many individuals & businesses are now extended to July 15 2020➡️ https://t.co/D8ziMHO8hh

This is good news. Thank you @SpeakerPelosi for your leadership on this. As a reminder our #COVID19 response package provides for:  ✅ Free testing. ✅ Paid emergency leave. ✅ Increased federal funds for Medicaid. ✅ Enhanced food security & unemployment insurance. https://t.co/VqdHXAFCTC
Important #COVID19 updates for veterans: https://t.co/vwanm9TkTn

NEWS: I’m joining @RepDavidTrone to share our concern regarding the impact of #COVID19 on the #Census and to ask for the @uscensusbureau’s plan to ensure an accurate count during this unprecedented health emergency. https://t.co/nOnTudDEQM https://t.co/eSvGqOfm4C
Constant news of #COVID19 outbreak can be extremely stressful for individuals families and kids. Here are some important steps for managing anxiety and stress from @CDCgov ➡️ https://t.co/76NLIKb7lU

NEWS: I'm joining @RepSpeier to ask for updates from the  @WhiteHouse about how they plan to use DOD resources such as mobile hospital units or the Army Corps of Engineers so Congress can provide a proper response and funding for these efforts. #COVID19 https://t.co/MLgahBNZar

$500M for low-income pregnant women & moms w/ young kids. $400M for food banks. $250M for home-delivered meals to low-income seniors.  Thanks to the leadership of @SpeakerPelosi Congress is moving swiftly & decisively to respond to #COVID19 by putting #FamiliesFirst. https://t.co/6WVXfZBllO
Nobody should be kicked out onto the street during a crisis like this. We need an immediate nationwide moratorium on evictions and foreclosures. #COVID19 #Coronavirus #mapoli  https://t.co/o7xt4o4pt8
